trading_routes_hubs.name: Suakin, Sudan
trading_routes_hubs.description: Possible northern edge of Punt based on ancient trade routes.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Dahlak Archipelago, Eritrea
trading_routes_hubs.description: Fits descriptions of Punt's coastal harbors and myrrh trees.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Berbera, Somalia
trading_routes_hubs.description: Considered by some scholars as a Punt trading center.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Ras Hafun, Somalia
trading_routes_hubs.description: A prehistoric trade site where Egyptians may have obtained gold, incense, and exotic animals.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Al-Ula & Dedan
trading_routes_hubs.description: Ancient city along the incense and spice trade. Lihyanite & Dedanite Kingdoms.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Elephantine
trading_routes_hubs.description: Southern trade & military outpost, near Aswan.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Pyla-Kokkinokremos
trading_routes_hubs.description: Abandoned city with Egyptian-Mycenaean artifacts. Short-lived fortified settlement (c. 1200 BCE), abandoned suddenly. Egyptian and Mycenaean pottery found here, suggesting a multicultural trading hub.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Berenice Troglodytica
trading_routes_hubs.description: Trade route to India. Egyptian ports used by the Romans for trade with India, Arabia, and East Africa.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Alexandria
trading_routes_hubs.description: Capital of Roman Egypt. The Hellenistic Capital. Ptolemaic Capital & Trade Hub.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Naukratis
trading_routes_hubs.description: The first Greek colony in Egypt. A Greek trading post established in the 7th century BCE, serving as a cultural and commercial bridge between Greece and Egypt.

trading_routes_hubs.name: Delos
trading_routes_hubs.description: The Island of Egyptian Gods. A major religious and trade hub, Delos had temples dedicated to Isis and Serapis, showing Egypt’s influence in the Aegean.
